reviews.review_msg: Prof Puskas was ana amazing prof! Highly recommend her to anyone considering taking this course the course is mainly made up of the two exams and project but if u pay attention in lecture and do the required reading the tests will be very simple and straightforward

I loved Dr. Puskas' lectures, they were always so interesting and well organized. This course is test heavy, and tons of participation marks. My group really screwed me over during a group project to where I ended up doing every bit of the work, and she understood that and I still received a really good grade on it. Amazing prof, humanitarian too.

Cathy cares about her students, and provides plenty of zoom meetings in case there is a touchy topic being covered in class. She just wants her students to be as comfortable as possible. Don't ditch class though, because there are participation marks during her lectures. Exams are based off the slides, not what she covers in lectures
She is an amazing professor. Attend all lectures and do all of the assignments at time. Pay attention in class and you will get good results for sure.

Cathy is a great prof. She taught hsci 1130 at langara this semester and this was the best health science I've taken ever. Her grading is clear and straight forward and her midterms and final exam were easy, she literally tells us what to study. The material in this course is pretty straightforward. Would really recommend cathy , take her classes!!

Worst prof ever. Couldnt answer student questions. Made the TA mark harder cuz we did too well, dropping me from a 95 to 78. Told us hints as to what would be on exams, that werent even on them. Didn't tell us exam format prior to us finding out it would be mostly written. Would skip through slides expecting us to just learn it. Ignores emails

Cathy is by far the best professor I've had! She wants you to do well and goes out of her way to meet up outside of her office hours. Her tests are fair to what she teaches and she even gives you a forewarning as to some questions that will be on her exams. Definitely take a class with her if you can! You'll be missing out if you don't!

I really enjoyed Cathy's class. The classes were really interesting and kept your attention. I feel like I learned a lot. The online discussions were cool and the in class quiz cards helped review. The guest speakers were great too! I would definitely take this class again.

Cathy is one of my favourite professors at SFU. She has been my TA and professor and she is honestly the most helpful, caring and nicest person! She is always available for extra help and replies back to emails with detailed feedback. I would highly recommend taking a course with her and hope she teaches more upper division courses! :)
Cathy is the nicest and most helpful TA ever! She defiantly cares about her students and goes out of her way to help them!
